0.name: 🍏 Apple Scab
0.description: Apple Scab causes dark lesions on fruit and leaves. Remove affected leaves and apply fungicide regularly.

1.name: 🍎 Apple Black Rot
1.description: Black Rot creates dark, sunken spots. Prune affected branches and use fungicide to prevent spread.

2.name: 🌳 Apple Cedar Rust
2.description: Orange rust spots appear on leaves. Remove infected leaves and apply fungicide early in the season.

3.name: 🍏 Apple Healthy
3.description: Tree shows no signs of disease. Keep it healthy with regular care and pruning.

4.name: 🫐 Blueberry Healthy
4.description: Lush leaves and plump berries indicate health. Ensure proper watering and pruning.

5.name: 🍒 Cherry Powdery Mildew
5.description: White, powdery spots on leaves. Prune affected areas and apply fungicide.

6.name: 🍒 Cherry Healthy
6.description: Green leaves and juicy cherries. Water regularly and protect from pests.

7.name: 🌽 Corn Cercospora Leaf Spot
7.description: Dark circular spots on leaves. Use fungicide and remove infected foliage.

8.name: 🌽 Corn Common Rust
8.description: Reddish pustules appear on leaves. Fungicides can help in wet conditions.

9.name: 🌽 Corn Northern Leaf Blight
9.description: Long gray lesions appear on leaves. Plant resistant varieties and remove infected parts.

10.name: 🌽 Corn Healthy
10.description: Tall stalks and green leaves. Provide proper spacing and nutrients.

11.name: 🍇 Grape Black Rot
11.description: Black, rotting spots on grapes. Remove and destroy affected grapes. Apply fungicide.

12.name: 🍇 Grape Esca (Black Measles)
12.description: Dark streaks appear on stems. Avoid overwatering and prune infected parts.

13.name: 🍇 Grape Leaf Blight
13.description: Dark spots on grape leaves. Prune infected areas and apply fungicide.

14.name: 🍇 Grape Healthy
14.description: Healthy clusters with green leaves. Maintain sunlight and air circulation.

15.name: 🍊 Citrus Greening (HLB)
15.description: Yellowing leaves and bitter fruit. No cure—control psyllids and remove infected trees.

16.name: 🍑 Peach Bacterial Spot
16.description: Black spots on leaves and fruit. Apply copper fungicide and prune infected branches.

17.name: 🍑 Peach Healthy
17.description: Plump peaches and green leaves. Regular pruning and watering help maintain health.

18.name: 🌶️ Pepper Bacterial Spot
18.description: Dark lesions on leaves and stems. Use copper sprays and avoid overhead watering.

19.name: 🌶️ Pepper Healthy
19.description: Firm peppers and vibrant leaves. Ensure good drainage and full sunlight.

20.name: 🥔 Potato Early Blight
20.description: Dark concentric spots on leaves. Use fungicide and remove infected leaves.

21.name: 🥔 Potato Late Blight
21.description: Rapid decay of leaves and tubers. Destroy infected plants and apply fungicide immediately.

22.name: 🥔 Potato Healthy
22.description: Strong green leaves and firm tubers. Proper soil care ensures plant health.

23.name: 🍓 Raspberry Healthy
23.description: Healthy raspberries with no discoloration. Maintain airflow and remove dead canes.

24.name: 🌱 Soybean Healthy
24.description: Green pods and uniform growth. Control pests and use balanced fertilization.

25.name: 🎃 Squash Powdery Mildew
25.description: White powder on leaves. Improve airflow and apply fungicides.

26.name: 🍓 Strawberry Leaf Scorch
26.description: Browning leaf edges and dried tips. Water consistently and remove infected leaves.

27.name: 🍓 Strawberry Healthy
27.description: Bright leaves and sweet fruit. Keep soil moist and weed-free.

28.name: 🍅 Tomato Bacterial Spot
28.description: Dark, water-soaked leaf spots. Apply copper sprays and remove affected parts.

29.name: 🍅 Tomato Early Blight
29.description: Concentric brown spots on lower leaves. Use fungicides and practice crop rotation.

30.name: 🍅 Tomato Late Blight
30.description: Fast-spreading leaf and fruit rot. Remove infected plants immediately and apply fungicide.

31.name: 🍅 Tomato Leaf Mold
31.description: Yellowing with moldy spots. Reduce humidity and apply sulfur-based sprays.

32.name: 🍅 Tomato Septoria Leaf Spot
32.description: Tiny brown spots with light centers. Remove infected leaves and use fungicides.

33.name: 🍅🕷️ Tomato Spider Mites
33.description: Yellow specks and webbing on leaves. Use miticides and rinse with water.

34.name: 🍅 Tomato Target Spot
34.description: Bullseye-pattern spots on leaves. Apply fungicides and remove infected foliage.

35.name: 🍅 Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
35.description: Yellow, curled leaves. Control whiteflies and remove infected plants.

36.name: 🍅 Tomato Mosaic Virus
36.description: Mottled, distorted leaves. No cure—remove infected plants and sterilize tools.

37.name: 🍅 Tomato Healthy
37.description: Vibrant leaves and firm fruit. Provide nutrients, sun, and water consistently.
